channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Week Ahead: November 16
item.description: Retail sales for October will be released on Tuesday, which will tell us more about the strength of the American consumer. Earnings: We're just about ready to put Q3 earnings season in the rearview, but not before retailers including Walmart, Target, and Home Depot report their financials for the previous quarter early this week.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Asian-Pacific Countries Sign Historic Free Trade Deal
item.description: On Sunday, 15 Asian-Pacific countries docusigned one of the largest free trade deals in history, the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP).   The U.S. didn't get the invite. Most importantly, it includes China—the largest economy in the region.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Biden Transition Team Elevates Racial Inequality Experts
item.description: Within their economic transition teams, Biden and VP-elect Kamala Harris have tapped experts in racial inequality, including...
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Conservative Social Platform Parler Is Spreading Election Misinformation
item.description: Big picture: Compared to Twitter's 187 million daily users and Facebook properties’ 1.8 billion, Parler is still a small fish.   And now, election misinformation. Parler was envisioned as a libertarian platform for conservatives who felt censored by social media platforms, and it gained high-profile users including Fox Business anchor Maria Bartiromo, talk show host Dan Bongino, and Senators Ted Cruz and Rand Paul. Election 2020 winners: pizza delivery, headache hats, and conservative social network Parler.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Anime Has Found Receptive International Audience in Recent Years
item.description: Anime is going from niche → mainstream faster than air fryers, according to the WSJ: More than 100 million households around the world watched at least one anime title on Netflix in the year to September 2020.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: SpaceX’s First Officially Sanctioned Manned Mission Blasts Off
item.description: A SpaceX Dragon spacecraft, nicknamed “Resilience” by its crew, is scheduled to fire off into the friendly skies tomorrow night. Sunday’s lift-off is the U.S.’ first Federal Aviation Administration-approved, manned space mission since the Space Shuttle was sent to the island of misfit rockets in 2011.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Kim Ng Makes History After Landing the General Manager Job for the Miami Marlins
item.description: Looking ahead: Ng won’t have a lot of cash to build a roster with.    She’s got a lengthy résumé: Ng got into baseball as an intern for the Chicago White Sox in 1990. She is the newest general manager of MLB’s Miami Marlins, and the first female GM in any of the major North American men’s sports leagues.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Top Business Leaders Prepare for Trump-Biden Transition
item.description: Concerned execs at more than two dozen major U.S. companies held a videoconference last week to hash out a plan should President Trump refuse to leave office, the AP reported yesterday. All 50 states were called as of yesterday, with Biden securing 306 electoral votes to Trump’s 232.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Checking in on the "Third Wave"
item.description: In NYC, Mayor Bill de Blasio suggested the city may have to shut down in-person learning at public schools as early as Monday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: DoorDash, Pandemic Winner, Reveals IPO Prospectus
item.description: Quick backstory: DoorDash was founded in 2013 by Stanford students, and it’s raised $2.5 billion since, from the likes of SoftBank and other heavy-hitter VCs.  DoorDash divides people more than cilantro  While most business writers agree the economics of running a food delivery company are challenging, some are more confident than others in DoorDash’s sustainability.     The food delivery startup released its IPO prospectus, giving the public a comprehensive view of its business before heading to the public markets in the next few weeks.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Top Business Leaders Prepare for Trump-Biden Transition
item.description: Concerned execs at more than two dozen major U.S. companies held a videoconference last week to hash out a plan should President Trump refuse to leave office, the AP reported yesterday. item.title: The Brew Crossword: Walking or Riding?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Checking in on the "Third Wave"
item.description: In NYC, Mayor Bill de Blasio suggested the city may have to shut down in-person learning at public schools as early as Monday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Pandemic Has Led to a Golf Boom
item.description: One golf accessory in particular drew Peloton-esque demand: the humble pushcart. Golf equipment sales were up 42% year-over-year in Q3, and in May, golf bag accessories were the No. 1 trending retail category on Google.   Golf’s sudden appeal has benefited the business side of the game, too.   Will the good times last?   We’re in the middle of a golf boom In September, 25.5% more golf rounds were played than last year, which capped off a wildly popular summer for the sport. And golf rose to the occasion: We Are Golf, a coalition of golf organizations, collaborated closely with the federal government and the CDC to draw up guidelines to make the game safer.   Bottom line: As a young golf nerd, my advice to people who want to grow the game is to make it more accessible. And for people who’ve never understood the appeal of golf, watch the final round of The Masters today.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Next Wave of IPOs Includes DoorDash and Airbnb
item.description: Big picture: As bad as this year has been for procuring dumbbells, it's been quite hospitable to companies going public. It would be one of the biggest U.S. IPOs of the year.   Wish is an e-commerce app that sells ridiculously cheap items.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Chipotle Debuts First Ghost Kitchen
item.description: Another benefit of ghost kitchens?   In Q3, Chipotle's digital sales soared over 200% yearly to $776 million.   Big picture: Covid-19 has been devastating the restaurant biz. Chipotle's version offers pickup as well.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: We Could Get Used to This: Americans Embrace Remote Work, per Exclusive Morning Brew Polling
item.description: A Morning Brew/Harris poll conducted last weekend found that… Two-thirds (67%) of remote workers say their lifestyle has gotten healthier since working from home. About the same amount (38%) say they've been taking time to cook their meals. This year's social distancing mandates have made employees much more familiar with each other's living rooms.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Powell: Rising U.S. Covid Cases Threaten Economic Recovery
item.description: Can a vaccine fix things?   Flattening the curve is made even harder by widespread pandemic fatigue.    "Certainly it's not going to be a pandemic for a lot longer, because I believe the vaccines are going to turn that around," Dr. Anthony Fauci said this week. Yesterday, Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot asked residents to go virtual this Thanksgiving and only venture out for essential needs. Parts of the economy are steadily recovering, but as a growing number of state and local governments reimpose restrictions on business activity and social life, "people may lose confidence that it is safe to go out," Powell said.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Powell: Rising U.S. Covid Cases Threaten Economic Recovery

item.title: The Brew’s Weekly News Quiz: November 13
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: The Essentials, Issue #81: Stuffing
item.description: Don’t know what to do with yourself on the holiday?   Stay Sharp  Snooze the right way: For all the stomach-sleepers, it’s time to change your sleep habits.   Here’s how to bring your family together while you’re apart.     Happy Place    Busà Photography / Getty Images Ah, Central Park in the fall. Leading Off    Giphy The best parts of Thanksgiving: mashed sweet potatoes with toasted marshmallows on top (golden, not burnt); the acceptable midday nap; and the leftovers.   Dept.   If you’re sick of cooking already, these Thanksgiving foods ship nationwide.   Keep it simple and gobble up a Thanksgiving-themed sheet-pan meal.   R&R   LauriPatterson / Getty Images Spoonful of sugar: Whether you’re a lazy baker, a procrasti-baker, or a Martha Stewart in the making, whisk your way through this list of easy baking recipes with five ingredients or fewer. Your Thanksgiving dinner may not have as many chairs or as big a dessert table this year, but we’ve got a few ideas to make your Thanksgiving takeout and outdoor celebration a little bit better. Now she’s inspiring scientific research.
item.author: Rachel Cantor

item.title: The Masters Returns...in November
item.description: The Masters golf tournament tees off today at Augusta National Golf Club in Georgia. Tony Finau. The Brew's pick? $3 for a chicken wrap! That means we'll have to accept fall foliage in place of flowering azaleas.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Facebook and Google Extend Their Broad Sweeping Bans on Political Ads
item.description: Bottom line: Critics argue the ad ban doesn’t address the real issue afflicting social media—the spread of misinformation in unpaid, organic posts. Much like we had planned to always wear pants while working, Facebook and Google had planned to lift their bans on political advertising one week after the election concluded.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: TikTok Complains U.S. Government Went Silent on Divestiture Deadline
item.description: Now, TikTok owner ByteDance says the U.S. government left it on read. Chinese-owned video sharing giant TikTok, whose potential sale dominated the news over the summer, returned to the headlines with a court petition filed on Tuesday. to warmer months. On Thursdays, we throw back...
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Disney+ Turns 1: How’d It Do?
item.description: Y/N   + Flash poll: Is Baby Yoda cute? while the pandemic delayed production timelines, Disney+ expects to release more original content next year, including—what else—more Marvel and Star Wars series.   Looking ahead...
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Sony and Microsoft Take Different Approaches in Their Latest Console War
item.description: With the launch of the Sony PlayStation 5 today and Microsoft’s Xbox Series X and S on Tuesday, this week marks harmonic convergence of the console giants all over again—an endless cycle of hyped hardware releases that occurs every eight-ish years. Sony continues to be the hardware leader for die-hard gamers. P.S. Neither Sony nor Microsoft is expected to sell the most consoles this holiday season. A new offering called “All Access” lets gamers pay for the new Xbox in monthly installments, and—here’s the kicker—also signs them up for Xbox’s Netflix-like Game Pass Ultimate gaming subscription service.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.description: The Masters golf tournament tees off today at Augusta National Golf Club in Georgia.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Virtual Events Startup Hopin Vaults Past $2 Billion Valuation
item.description: Then Covid-19 arrived and so did blazing-fast growth.   Hopin also says it's profitable, with annual recurring revenue of $20 million. But Hopin's betting it can find a foothold in a post-Covid economy with "hybrid" events. Users?
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Fed Governor Lael Brainard Rumored Frontrunner for Biden Treasury
item.description: If she isn't...   If picked... other folks reportedly under consideration include Ariel Investments co-CEO Mellody Hobson, Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic, and Powell's predecessor, Janet Yellen.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Singles Day to Test China's Consumer Demand
item.description: Big picture: The pandemic pushed more Chinese consumers to e-commerce, and Singles Day will provide more intel on the health of the Chinese economy.   Alibaba kicked sales off a little early this year, and as of 12:30am local time, consumers spent $56.3 billion on its Taobao and Tmall e-commerce platforms.
item.author: Alex Hickey
